item.title: Put a couple of bins along the road, please., 6th August
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: The high street pavement (shops side) is always absolutely filthy. There are no bins for people to put their household rubbish, the foxes rip everything during the night and in the morning there is rubbish covering the whole pavement pretty much everyday. I talked to several neighbours and everyone is unhappy with the current situation. The solution is simple: put some public bins so people can leave their rubbish covered and the street will look much better. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? Put a couple of bins along the road, please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, High Street, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree branches blocking streetlamp., 6th August
item.description:
Alleyway located between Plevna Crescent and St. Ann's Road, adjacent to 38, St. Ann's Road. Overhanging tree branches are blocking light from lamp PC 834H. causing part of the alleyway to remain in darkness. This is stressful for users of this alleyway during the hours of darkness.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Ann's Road, West Green, London

item.title: Bin left on the road every day. Rats in the bin, 6th August
item.description:
This bin is left on road every day of the week with rubbish on the side. Not only stops people from using the pavement but yesterday I saw a rat coming out of it! Apparently it belongs to someone not living on the street, how is that possible? The bin and rubbish are located on the corner of 1 Heavitree Road. This is going on for years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wordsworth Road, Falconwood, London
